creator: cdhuang_98@yahoo.com
text:
Hi,

My apache installation was configured with the following:

./configure --prefix=/export/home/apache/apache2 --enable-rewrite=shared --
enable-speling=shared --enable-so

I followed the directions under on bea's web site to install the Apache2.0 HTTP 
Server Plugin-In:

http://e-docs.bea.com/wls/docs70/plugins/apache.html

But, afterwards, Apache fails to start due to this symbol resolution error:

[djdisk] bin % apachectl start
Syntax error on line 1057 of /export/home/apache/apache2/conf/httpd.conf:
Cannot load /export/home/apache/apache2/modules/mod_wl_20.so into server: 
ld.so.1: /export/home/apache/apache2/bin/httpd: fatal: relocation error: 
file /export/home/apache/apache2/modules/mod_wl_20.so: symbol apr_lock_acquire: 
referenced symbol not found
[djdisk] bin %

Do you have any idear where this "apr_lock_acquire" symbol is defined?
How can I fix this error?

Thanks,
Carlton

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
apr_lock_require() was deprecated a long time ago and finally removed 6 months
ago (before Apache 2.0.36).

You should contact the module vendor to see what to do.  This isn't something
we can handle.

creator: cdhuang_98@yahoo.com
text:
(Carlton Huang - 10/10/02)

BEA's WL70 is certified to be compatible with Apache2.0.39.
I don't think BEA has a "mod_wl_20.so" that'll work with Apache2.0.43, yet.

You must use the "mod_wl_20.so" found under: 
http://dev2dev.bea.com/managed_content/direct/apache2.0/apache20.zip
-or-
http://dev2dev.bea.com/code/codedirect.jsp?highlight=codedirect

(helpful urls)
http://edocs.bea.com/wls/docs70/plugins/apache.html
http://e-docs.bea.com/wls/certifications/certifications/sun_solaris2.html#39669

CAUTION: 
For unix installations, you must make sure your OS is either 2.6 or 2.7.
Make sure the patches are the latest.

I had trouble with using my 2.6 machine, but was successful using my 2.7 
machine.  When ever you see errors about not finding symbols in .so files, the 
OS is likely the culprit.

I'm up and running.

Thanks,
-Carlton
